message:
SYSTEM: Metodolog%C3%ADa-2-MC-ODPs.pdf: Página 4
© A. Gómez Pérez, M.C. Suárez-Figueroa, B. Villazón
4
Ontological Engineering
Types of Ontology Design Patterns
http://ontologydesignpatterns.org/wiki/OPTypes
Content 
OPs 
(CPs) 
encode 
conceptual, rather than logical design 
patterns.
• Logical OPs solve design problems 
independently 
of 
a 
particular 
conceptualization.
• CPs propose patterns for solving design 
problems for the domain classes and 
properties that populate an ontology. 
They address content problems.
Logical ODPs are formal expressions, 
whose only parts are expressions from a 
logical vocabulary e.g., OWL DL, that 
solve a problem of expressivity
• Logical ODPs are independent from a 
specific domain of interest, i.e. they are 
content-independent
• Logical ODPs solve design problems 
where the primitives of the representation 
language do not directly support certain 
logical constructs
speaker: SYSTEM
